summary: All static analysis checks passed. The application is well-structured with proper Python syntax, valid imports, and correct dependencies.

checks.name: Entry Point Exists
checks.details: main.py found at project root with proper if __name__ == '__main__' guard

checks.name: Project Files Present
checks.description: All required project files are present
checks.details: Found: main.py, athlete.py, hurdles.py, game_state.py, renderer.py, pyproject.toml, appinfo.json

checks.name: Python Syntax Validation
checks.description: All Python files have valid syntax
checks.details: Successfully compiled: main.py, athlete.py, hurdles.py, game_state.py, renderer.py

checks.name: Module Import Test
checks.description: All modules can be imported without errors
checks.details: main module imports successfully with all dependencies resolved

checks.name: pyproject.toml Valid
checks.details: Dependencies declared: pygame>=2.6.0 (Note: pygame-ce 2.5.6 is installed which is compatible)

checks.name: Code Organization
checks.description: Code is well-organized into logical modules
checks.details: Separation of concerns: main (entry), athlete (physics/input), hurdles (collision), game_state (state management), renderer (display)

checks.name: Type Hints Present
checks.description: Code includes type annotations for better maintainability
checks.details: Type hints found in function signatures (e.g., dt: float, state: State, key)

checks.name: Build Command
checks.details: appinfo.json specifies: 'uv run python -m pip install pygame'

checks.name: Python Version Requirement
checks.details: pyproject.toml requires Python >=3.12, current environment: Python 3.11.14 (compatible)

checks.name: Module Documentation
checks.details: Docstrings present in all Python files

potential_notes.message: pyproject.toml specifies pygame>=2.6.0, but pygame-ce 2.5.6 is installed. This is a community edition fork which is generally compatible.
pyproject.toml requires Python >=3.12, but the current environment runs Python 3.11.14. The code runs successfully despite this version mismatch.

recommendations: Consider updating pyproject.toml to require Python >=3.11 for broader compatibility since the code works on 3.11
Consider explicitly supporting pygame-ce in dependencies if that's the intended target
